isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI/DTA - 466 C SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - ACCELERATOR LINKAGE DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Engines (With Robert Bosch "MW" or "A" Fuel Injection Pump) - THROTTLE LINKAGE ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE:

para.emph: [Without Bellcrank] Refer to Figure 6.10 for Version "I" Linkage (Standard Regulation Governor), Figure 6.11 for Version "II" Linkage (Close Regulation Governor).

step1.para:
Disconnect the upper and lower springs at the locations shown in Figure 6.9
.
Temporarily connect the upper spring to the outer control lever spring roller as shown in Figure 6.9.
Move the control lever assembly by hand to assure the (cast) inner throttle lever is against the stop screw. The spring will hold the lever in place during gauge measurement.

figure.caption: Figure 6.9 Throttle Spring Location for Linkage Adjustment [DT/DTA-466 w/ MW Pump Shown]

important.para: THE CONTROL LEVER MUST NOT BREAKAWAY INTO THE OVER-TRAVEL POSITION DURING THIS ADJUSTMENT PROCEDURE.

step1.para: Use a ruler to measure the gauge dimension, as shown in Figures 6.10, 6.11 and 6.12.

figure.caption: Figure 6.10 "S" Series Version "I" Linkage (Without Bellcrank) [Robert Bosch MW Pump with Standard Regulation Governor]
Figure 6.11 "S" Series Version "II" Linkage (Without Bellcrank) [Robert Bosch MW Pump with Close Regulation Governor]

note.para: For Robert Bosch "A" Pumps used on 1989 Model Year D185 - 185 HP @ 2600 RPM Applications, use the gauge dimension shown in Figure 6.11, 5 - 5.75in.

figure.caption: Figure 6.12 1991-1992 Model Year Throttle Linkage [Robert Bosch MW Pump Shown "A" Pump is Similar

step1.para:
If gauge dimension requires adjustment, disconnect the upper spring from the outer control lever spring roller. Refer to insert, Figure 6.9.
Loosen the lever clamping bolt and change the mounting position of the lever on the throttle shaft until the correct gauge dimension is obtained.
Tighten the lever clamping bolt as specified in Figure 6.13.

important.para: DO NOT POSITION LEVER IN SHAFT GROOVE AND DO NOT FORCE LEVER INTO OVER-TRAVEL FOR THIS POSITIONING.

step1.para: Depress accelerator pedal to floor of cab.
Move the injection pump lever to high idle stop. Do not force the lever into over-travel for this positioning.
Rotate the ball joint coupling on end of accelerator cable until the ball stud can be inserted in the lever hole.
Remove stud from hole and rotate the ball joint on the cable two turns in the direction which shortens the cable.
Release the accelerator and attach ball joint to the pump lever.

This procedure should result in control lever over-travel of one half the available movement (8° ± 1° ) when the accelerator pedal is pressed to the floor. If this does not result from the first adjustment repeat the procedure until the proper over-travel is obtained.
Reinstall the upper and lower throttle return springs to thier original positions. Refer to Figure 6.3.

important.para: BEFORE STARTING THE ENGINE, ENTER THE OPERATOR'S COMPARTMENT AND DEPRESS THE THROTTLE PEDAL SEVERAL TIMES TO CHECK FOR SMOOTH ACTION AND FULL RETURN OF THE THROTTLE LEVER AND THROTTLE PEDAL. THIS MUST BE DONE ANY TIME COMPONENTS ARE REPLACED, REASSEMBLED OR ADJUSTED. ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES.

note.para: TIGHTEN THE BOLT TO 55 IN-LBS. AFTER THE CORRECT GAUGE DIMENSION IS ACHIEVED
